p: Even the strongest mitigation efforts assumed in the RCPs will not prevent increasing SWS, and therefore, timely adaptation action is required. Strategies to reduce the impacts of water shortages on WhP could include (i) shifting the wheat growing season; (ii) full or partial irrigation; (iii) increasing the water use efficiency by, among other things, enhancing rainfall infiltration and reducing soil evaporation; and (iv) using wheat varieties with enhanced drought and heat tolerance.
